s1: This course covers a range of concepts, techniques and technologies in network security.
s2: This course teaches introductory programming within a problem solving framework applicable to the sciences.

s1: This includes an overview of relevant network protocols and cryptography; analyses of designs and implementations of security protocols, including basic tools and techniques; an understanding of network threats and attacks such as eavesdropping, spoofing, protocol failures, DoS attacks and man-in-the-middle attacks; network defence including threat analysis and identification, architecture control, intrusion detection and layered security.
s2: Have an understanding of practical aspects of machine architecture including finite precision and rounding errors.

s1: The course features hands-on lectures and labs to analyse network vulnerabilities, and design and implement appropriate defensive techniques.
s2: The course emphasises technical programming, the simulation of scientific systems and the processing of scientific data.
Have an awareness of good program organisation.

s1: Understand various threats and vulnerabilities of a network, and explain appropriate countermeasures.
s2: Have an understanding of practical aspects of machine architecture including finite precision and rounding errors.

s1: Perform simple penetration testing of a network and network services
s2: Have an understanding of practical aspects of machine architecture including finite precision and rounding errors.

s1: Perform a threat analysis / vulnerability assessment of protocol designs and implementations.
s2: Have an understanding of practical aspects of machine architecture including finite precision and rounding errors.

s1: Design and implement appropriate defensive countermeasures against identified threats and vulnerabilities.
s2: Design, write and debug small programs to solve practical problems of a scientific nature.
